entry.title: Replace ConsentLevel::kSync usage in WebHistory
entry.content:
WebHistoryService and its factory used to check for ConsentLevel::kSync

and IsSyncFeatureActive(), for historic reasons.

This CL removes the unnecessary IsSyncFeatureActive() check in the

factory (the remaining GetActiveDataTypes() check covers all the

necessary conditions), and also removes the ConsentLevel::kSync usage

in the service itself (behind the kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos

feature).



The same changes were previously made for iOS in crrev.com/c/4725068

and crrev.com/c/4813815.



Bug: 40067770

Change-Id: I9deb9ba18fa287fb4aaef1097858f377cbf38122

entry.title: [Telemetry] Fix crash when no active browser issue
entry.content:
During the verification of requests to Telemetry Extension, we check if

the active browser is the companion app ui. Meanwhile, the active

browser can possibly be nullptr if there is no browser present. Add a

pointer check to prevent crashing Chrome.



Bug: b/325999285

Test: Test manually on DUT

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*Telemetry*Event*"

Test: extensions_unittests --gtest_filter="*TelemetryExtension*"

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="*TelemetryExtensionEvents*"

Test: tast run $dut telemetryextension.PlatformAPIEvent*.ash*

entry.title: iwa: Owned bundles can now be dev-mode or prod-mode
entry.content:
This will allow us to copy dev mode bundles into the profile directory.

Currently, using dev mode bundles is half-broken, because when you

update the bundle on disk, our code does not realize that the bundle

was updated and instead continues reading at offsets based on metadata

from the old bundle. This CL is the pre-requisite for optionally copying

dev-mode bundles into the profile directory, instead of referencing

them.



Eventually, I think it would be nice to

a) fix our code to support the developer updating a referenced dev-mode

bundle file on disk without it messing up open readers for it.

b) give developers the option to specify whether they want to copy their

bundles into the profile directory (to have it installed a bit more

permanently), or keep the current behavior where the bundle remains

outside of the browser's control and can be updated by the developer

easily.



Fixed: 287594073

Bug: 325595783, 40239527

Change-Id: Ic8b6833601fc225c575a0cb0ced181ba3a368a48

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318496

Reviewed-by: Gavin Williams

Commit-Queue: Christian Flach

Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

Reviewed-by: Robbie McElrath

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269439}

entry.title: [FspCache] Vend a ContentCache to each CloudFileSystem on init
entry.content:
The CacheManager manages the logic that relates to all the individual

FSP content caches. When an FSP mounts, it requires access to an

in-memory LRU cache, a connection to the SQLite database and access to

the files on disk. All these parts are aggregated in this new class

called the ContentCache.



To avoid persisting data on disk, this also introduces a boolean that

can be enabled on the CacheManager to not create the FspContentCache

directory.



Bug: b/317137739

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=FileSystemProviderCacheManagerTest*

entry.title: Reland "Sync bounds for mirror layers."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit bfd714210e762ddbf54b4261ed514feb879da572



Previously, this broke because tile occlusion was not enabled and

old content was being shown with wrong bounds, so syncing to those

bounds made everything transparent.



With tile occlusion enabled, windows know when they are shown and will

produce new content, so sync bounds should get content with proper

bounds it is safe to sync to. Without this, old bounds from snapshots

will be positioned incorrectly and show some transparent gap.



Original change's description:

> Sync bounds for mirror layers.

>

> Bug: 40223673

> Test: CQ + local testing

entry.title: Remove CHECK for state->readable()
entry.content:
This CL removes existing CHECK if the mojo state is readable, right

after Read() method. Because in rare case state->readable() is false

even right after DataPipe::ReadData() and the result was success [1].



We can't guarantee that the state is always readable, but probably it's

okay to ignore the state because the data pipe already gave the buffer

info, and the next Read() will be called when it's readable next time.

Also we set a crash key for the future crash. So this CL just removes

CHECK().



Note: We need to call DataPipe::ReadData() even it's not readable state

to know that we read all data in the data pipe. So we can't move this to

before calling DataPipe::ReadData().



[1] https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?q=expanded_custom_data.ChromeCrashProto.magic_signature_1.name+LIKE+%27%25ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequest%25%27+AND+product.Version%3D%27124.0.6341.0%27&stbtiq=&reportid=&index=0#0



Bug: 327749443

entry.title: Fix possible null pointer dereference in RenderFrameHostImpl::GetPage
entry.content:
Currently if you call RenderFrameHost::GetPage on RFH which commits

navigation from under the following stack you will get invalid Page

reference (dereferenced null pointer) because

DocumentAssociatedData::owned_page_ is set to null at the moment.



base::SupportsUserData::ClearAllUserData()

content.dll!content::PageImpl::~PageImpl()

...

std::__Cr::unique_ptr::~unique_ptr()

content::DocumentAssociatedData::~DocumentAssociatedData()

...

std::__Cr::optional::emplace...

content::RenderFrameHostImpl::DidCommitNavigationInternal

content::RenderFrameHostImpl::DidCommitNavigation

...



This could happen in practice if a custom PageUserData implementation is being destroyed and a code called from the destructor ends up trying to reference RFH::GetPage().



Proposed fix is to clear Page user data before destroying owned_page_.



Change-Id: I9d8960cfd8b4a9fbec2c7888513b3f0823e7972f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5323981

entry.title: [Telemetry] Restrict manufacturer fallback to certain models
entry.content:
We plan to deprecate the fallback logic for reading manufacturer from

DMI. Restrict the fallback to certain models in order to limit the

impact and prevent new models from relying on DMI.



telemetry extension APIs are both accessible or both not

accessible before and after the changes.

1. model=eldrid, with cros-config filled

2. model=drawcia, with cros-config not filled but with DMI filled

3. model=lillipup, with both cros-config and DMI not filled



Bug: b:325560417, b:300015436

entry.title: ELUD: Improve the initialization process
entry.content:
It turned out that the default PartitionRoot for PA-E may not have

been configured(initialized) by the time that

InstallExtremeLightweightDetectorHooks() is called.



This patch supports a lazy set-up process of Extreme LUD so that

it's okay that the default PartitionRoot will be configured later.



This patch also supports the parameter configuration.

entry.title: LCPP: PredictFetchedFontUrls() returns an empty list on the feature disabled
entry.content:
Currently, even if the feature flag is disabled, the font URLs are

returned to PredictFetchedFontUrls() callers. It means that caller gets

the hint data regardless of the feature is enabled or not, and it can

be sent to the renderer.



For ease of ensuring the flag, let me enforce that by not sending a hint

to the callers.



In the coming CL, I plan to use this for consolidating the threshold

implementation.



Bug: 316229761

Change-Id: I08743a37694a5a85bc5c5af07e1d2b441f98f82b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5348086

entry.title: Use InsertNodeBefore() on indenting a <blockquote>
entry.content:
This CL replaces InsertNodeAfter() with InsertNodeBefore() on indenting

a
. InsertNodeAfter() has been used since [1].

When a eixsting
has an image and a created


for indenting is inserted after the existing node, the selection for

deletion after cloning is canonicalized to non-range and

DeleteSelection() does nothing. It causes there are two
s

with children, one is the existing
supposed to be deleted

and the other is the cloned
.

In order to fix the issue above, this change uses InsertNodeBefore()

instead of InsertNodeAfter() to find the next node and the previous node

for canonicalization without interference of the inserted


and have the correct selection for deletion.



[1] http://crbug.com/625802



Bug: 327665597

Change-Id: I3362a589ae5ac886fe301f605c2f0100807b3e39

entry.title: WebApps: UDM database migration from default->CrOS only, not the reverse
entry.content:
With the addition of a CrOS UserDisplayMode field [1], logic was added to web_app_sync_bridge to populate the field right after the database

was opened. This CL slightly simplifies that logic to only populate the

UDM-CrOS field from the UDM-Default field, instead of also populating

the UDM-Default field from the UDM-CrOS field (which should never happen

in practice). The field is still populated with Standalone if unset.



In preparation for upcoming CL to store the whole sync proto.



[1]: crrev.com/c/5154778

entry.title: viz: Restart overlay read access for single buffer overlay
entry.content:
Use SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_CONCURRENT_READ_WRITE usage flag as a proxy check

for single-buffered overlay.



Existing behavior assumes a new write fence only comes with a new

buffer (SI). This may not hold for single-buffered overlay where the

buffer is always the same, but there may be a new write fence if

buffer contains updates. This change allows single-buffered overlay

to pick up a new write fence for a new frame, by recreating

ScopedReadAccess.



Bug: 40288143

entry.title: [bfcache] Make open broadcast channel not blocking BFCache
entry.content:
This CL makes pages with open broadcast channels eligible for back/forward cache.



Currently, if there's an open broadcast channel, the page becomes ineligible for BFCache with the blocklisted reason `kBroadcastChannel`.



In this CL, a page with open broadcast channels can enter BFCache. If an open Broadcast channel is in a BFCached page, and receives a message from an active page's channel, the page gets evicted from bfcache. While the team had discussion about the "queueing" approach, this CL does not implement that as we need more discussion on privacy concerns.



A case that is not handled in this CL is where a broadcast channel in a dedicated worker has joined a bc channel, enters BFCache, and receives a message. Since the new implementation is guarded by a flag, we can create a follow-up CL later to handle that.



The design doc of this project: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1U0xWYF-UHRPkPTyb4vSl7GlQAt2xdL1DlSOxjkDS4Rw

entry.title: [Extensions c2s] Fix ReorderViews in the extensions container
entry.content:
Items in extensions container should follow:

- Pinned actions are first, added in the order provided

- Close side panel button is always last, if visible

- Extensions button is always second to last if close side panel

button is visible, or last otherwise

- Request access button is always third to last if close side panel

button is visible, or second to last otherwise

- Popped out extensions (e.g extension whose action is triggered and

is not pinned, extension who triggers a dialog) appear in between

pinned actions and the "control" buttons (request access,

extensions, and close side panel buttons)



This CL fixes two bugs:

- Request access button was not included in ReorderViews, causing

popped out extension to appear in between request access button and

extensions button

- "Other" buttons were reordered left-to-right. This was not correct

because it could leave an item added later that was to right of

request access button

entry.title: IDB: improvements to transaction timeout.
entry.content:
* In order to work around the fact that timers keep ticking while the

device is suspended (on some systems), break up the timer into 3 steps

that run consecutively. Only one of these steps would be skipped

while the system is suspended.



* Apply the timeout to readonly txns as well as readwrite, as readonly

txns can block others, i.e. they can block readwrite txns. (At the

time this timeout was originally implemented, readonly transactions

were non blocking.)



* Only abort transactions after the timeout if they are actually

blocking other transactions, and specifically those on another client

(tab). This is a behavioral change for a misbehaving single tab that

takes a long time to process a transaction result, but it maintains

the apparent original intent of the timeout, which is to deal with

renderers that have become "wedged" and are blocking other renderers.

It also limits the scope of this timeout workaround to cases where

it's more likely needed.

entry.title: IDB: shard backing stores across threads, part 3
entry.content:
In this part, each bucket context/backing store is given its own task

runner from the ThreadPool when the flag is enabled.



The approach that attempts to keep the IndexedDBBucketContext owned

by a unique_ptr is abandoned as it became too difficult to construct,

operate, and delete this object on one task runner, while holding

ownership on a different task runner (the main IDB task runner). Thus

this CL creates a second container for holding the bucket contexts

which holds them as `SequenceBound`, and which container is used

depends on the state of the feature flag. This leads to some

unfortunate code duplication but that should go away when the

functionality is enabled by default. Also this approach will make

removal of the old code simpler as it only involves deleting dead

paths and not rewriting live paths.



On testing: browser tests run in an environment that closely matches

production, including operating the backing stores on a separate task

runner when the flag is enabled. Unit tests that are easy to update

also run against multiple task runners as appropriate. However, some

unit tests disable the background task runners because the tests

themselves reach into bucket-sequence state from the main IDB sequence.

Updating them to work in a multi-threaded environment would be very

painful due to:



* the quantity of tests

* the timing assumptions they make (e.g. state that would change if

checked asynchronously)



Bug: 40279485

entry.title: Convert INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES in NetErrorToFileError()
entry.content:
base::File::FILE_ERROR_TOO_MANY_OPENED is converted to

net::ERR_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES in net::FileErrorToNetError(), but

the reverse is not true. This means for code paths that run

net::FileErrorToNetError() and then NetErrorToFileError(),

base::File::FILE_ERROR_TOO_MANY_OPENED comes out as

base::File::FILE_ERROR_FAILED.



This happens commonly for FileSystemProvider file systems, where the

JS API maps errors 1:1 with base::File errors, which must be converted

to net::FileErrors when interacting with various storage layers, and

then later converted back again.



Bug: b/325848400

entry.title: [E2E] Set the right navigation bar color when going from E2E to non E2E
entry.content:
Before: https://hsv.googleplex.com/5445338855899136

After: https://hsv.googleplex.com/5793187317678080



Verification steps:

1. Enable E2e flags (#draw-cutout-edge-to-edge and #draw-edge-to-edge)

2. Make sure you're in light theme

3. Go to a page that doesn't support E2E (ex: Wikipedia). The navigation bar should be white in light theme.

4. Go to a page that supports E2E (ex: Apple.com)

5. Navigate back to Wikipedia (I used back gesture in gesture navigation mode). Before: navigation bar shows up black. After: navigation bar shows up as the right color.

entry.title: Revert "Fix overlapping print page indicator on overlay scrollbars."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 396d08e0cb223ff75592e6d311d1a6f7da1dbb0e.



Reason for revert: Broke Mac 11 Tests.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/25765/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Abrowser_tests%2FPDFExtensionJSTest.Viewport%2FAll.0+VHash%3A2cf9c99b155a3ba3



Original change's description:

> Fix overlapping print page indicator on overlay scrollbars.

>

> In Linux and Windows, when Overlay scrollbars are enabled, the page

> indicator that appears next to the scrollbars when scrolling in the

> print page preview gets drawn on top of the scrollbars, instead of next

> to them.

>

> In MacOS, this issue is avoided by hardcoding a 16px margin between the

> edge of the screen and the page indicator. This causes the page

> page indicator to be drawn far enough to not overlap with the overlay

> thumb, and to not overlap with the expanded scrollbars you see when

> mousing over the scrollbars.

>

> This CL expands this margin to also be added when Overlay scrollbars

> are enabled in Windows and Linux (both regular and Fluent Overlay

> scrollbars).

>

> To reproduce this issue:

> 1. In Windows, enable overlay scrollbars via

> chrome://flags/#fluent-overlay-scrollbars

> or chrome://flags/#overlay-scrollbars

> 2. Go to any web page that would be printed in more than one page and

> open the print preview (Ctrl+P).

> 3. Scroll. The floating square with the page indicator gets drawn on

> top of the scrollbar's thumb, instead of floating next to it.

>

> Tested locally in Linux and Windows with both type of scrollbars

> (regular and Fluent) in overlay and non-overlay versions and verified

> that everything worked as expected.

>

> Bug: 1286009

> Change-Id: Ia8b4afa3b7a3dc7490c15314093e02684968a4cb

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5247173

> Commit-Queue: Gaston Rodriguez

> Reviewed-by: Demetrios Papadopoulos

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268833}



Bug: 1286009

speed penalty now is closer to 5x slower instead of 20x slower.

entry.title: [QuickStart]: Notify phone of update during download
entry.content:
We now handle resuming the update when a user cancels, so we don't need

to wait until a reboot is needed to notify phone. Notify phone during

consumer update DOWNLOADING step so that appropriate UI is shown on phone.

entry.title: [AssistData] Create a AXTree combiner for use by web_contents_accessibility_android
entry.content:
This CL continues the work of unifying the code paths for AssistData

requests on Android. We add a AXTreeCombiner similar to the previous

approach but keep the previous implementation in place to prevent

future churn. If this path is landed, the previous implementation in

web_contents_android and WebContentsImpl.java will be removed.

entry.title: Add interestaction attribute
entry.content:
This adds support for the experimental `interestaction` attribute,

as specified in the open-ui "Interest Invokers" explainer.



(https://open-ui.org/components/interest-invokers.explainer/)



The `interestaction` attribute maps to the IDL `interestAction` similar

to `invokeAction`.



This attribute currently has no behaviour changes associated with it,

that will be handled in follow-ups.
